title: Coup Fears Spike in Guinea-Bissau as Gunfire Heard in Capital
sub_head: A spate of coups has spread across West Africa over the past 18 months
body:
KAMPALA, Ugandaâ€”Fears are growing that the small West African nation of Guinea-Bissau is on the brink of a military takeover after heavy gunfire was heard near the main government complex, following a wave of putsches elsewhere in the region over the past 18 months.
The state television broadcaster Tuesday reported that a group it described as invaders had damaged the government palace and were holding officials inside. The 15-member West African bloc Economic Community of West African States criticized the assault, describing it as an attempted coup.
